key_changes: Converted RTL stylesheet to use CSS logical properties (margin-inline-start, margin-inline-end, padding-inline-start, padding-inline-end, inset-inline-start, inset-inline-end, border-inline-start, border-inline-end)
Removed all !important overrides - logical properties work automatically with dir attribute
Replaced left/right directional properties with start/end logical equivalents
Used rem units instead of px for spacing consistency
Added unicode-bidi isolation for proper text directionality handling

patterns_discovered.description: Systematic replacement of physical CSS properties (left, right, margin-left, margin-right) with logical equivalents (start, end, margin-inline-start, margin-inline-end)
patterns_discovered.benefit: Automatic RTL/LTR support without !important overrides or media queries

patterns_discovered.description: Repetitive utility classes for common spacing needs with consistent naming convention: [property]-[direction]-[scale]
patterns_discovered.benefit: Enables semantic HTML with single-class directional styling

patterns_discovered.description: Global unicode-bidi: isolate applied to all elements with specific reset for html/body
patterns_discovered.benefit: Prevents text direction inheritance issues in mixed-direction content

patterns_discovered.description: Four-tier spacing system (1=0.5rem, 2=1rem, 3=1.5rem, 4=2rem) applied consistently across margin and padding utilities
patterns_discovered.benefit: Maintainable, predictable spacing without magic numbers

gotchas_discovered.description: The refactored stylesheet uses pure CSS logical properties without fallbacks to physical properties (left/right). Requires browser support for CSS Logical Properties (supported in all modern browsers but may affect older browser support).
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Document minimum browser version requirements or add vendor-prefixed fallbacks if supporting older browsers

gotchas_discovered.description: Applying unicode-bidi: isolate globally to all elements could have unintended consequences for embedded content or complex bidirectional scenarios
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Test with actual RTL content (Hebrew, Arabic) and mixed-direction scenarios to ensure no side effects

gotchas_discovered.description: Only covers spacing (margin/padding), positioning, and borders. Other directional properties (float, transform-origin, etc.) are not included
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Extend utilities as needed for additional directional properties used in codebase

key_accomplishments: Successfully refactored RTL stylesheet to use modern CSS logical properties
Eliminated !important overrides through proper use of logical property cascading
Transitioned from physical (left/right) to logical (start/end) directional model
Established consistent utility class naming and spacing system
Added comprehensive documentation comment about approach and rationale
approach_outcome.technical_debt_addressed: Removed specificity-driven !important overrides, enabling cleaner cascade and easier maintenance
approach_outcome.code_robustness_improvement: Modern CSS support with automatic RTL/LTR switching via dir attribute

recommendations.recommendation: Test the refactored rtl.css with actual RTL content (Arabic, Hebrew) in a real browser to verify unicode-bidi isolation doesn't break expected behavior
Document minimum browser version requirements for CSS Logical Properties support and create migration guide for developers using old left/right properties
Extend logical property utilities to cover additional directional CSS properties (float, text-align variants, transform-origin) as needed by components
Consider extracting the spacing scale (0.5rem, 1rem, 1.5rem, 2rem) into CSS custom properties for consistency with other stylesheets
Review whether the global unicode-bidi: isolate on all elements impacts performance; consider more targeted application if needed
